Articles.Content:
^Ã¢â‚¬â€¹^KSP 1.0

I have a felling that new version has more, more lags than 0.90. Lags are every few seconds. All settings are setted for minimal. I haven't so good hardware, but previous version works... better. I thought that optimisation is one of the more important things that devs work ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Intel i7 M640

NVS 3100m
Please see the support stickies, we need your logs to determine anything ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I don't see a cause but there is a lot of log activity, you could try starting KSP with " -nolog" to see if it helps.

You can add the line to a shortcut properties or to the Steam custom launch box.

Well, it seem that is the same. But I have important information: lags are regular:

1 second is normal, 1 second are lags, 1 second is normal, 1 second are lags...

Sometimes time of normal playing is longer, but generally lags are always with 1 second delay.
Oh, are you seeing the clock turn yellow? There's a setting called delta time, if you lower that to about 0.3 it should help.
Well, I think it is a bit better. The clock is yellow when I look at the ship (from last scenario after decouple from station) and the planet behind him. Otherwise it is green and there is no lag.

I get yellow a lot, it's how the game swaps judder for a slightly slower but smooth game, it used to be a community fix called lagsbane that was added to stock around .18 ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

I'm getting the same thing since the update - whilst they're not every few seconds, they're every 5 minutes or so and happen for around 20-30 seconds (but the game then does continue).

[www.bassettmatthew.webspace.virginmedia.com/output_log.zip](www.bassettmatthew.webspace.virginmedia.com/output_log.zip)

Yes, something has been definitely broken with optimization . I hope the developers will fix it soon ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2017-07-04T10:49:44Z" title="07/04/2017 10:49  AM" data-short="7 yr">July 4, 2017</time> by Inversion**
No, your English seems to be fine.
